@tpbang
As per your Q "can you give the full details about to how to encode movie in mkv to avi? " The easiest and quicikest (for me) is mk2vob (it`s free and easy to use, see link below (l still owe those guys/gals some donation) like l said it`s FREE, so no payment.
http://www.3r1c.eu/mkv2vob/mkv2vob.exe
To your next Q "My DVD player supports the divx format .please sir help me...I have wasted hundreds of hour but couldn't able to convert. I used many converter but the they take very long time for conversion( usually 3 hours). 
No need to convert downloaded movies to watch on your divx enabled DVD player, just burn it to DVD disc (or better if your DVD player can play USB video)
For the burning of downloaded divx/xvid (which most downloaded movies are) to DVD, l use various software, but for ease of use DIVX Player comes trump see link below.Like l said for ease of use and Once you get to know all the softwares available you can choose and pick)
http://www.divx.com/en/software/download/start
Hope it helps.

tpbang

If there is no need for size change try something that works for me!
Go to- My computer, tools, folder options,view- then uncheck box where it says -hide extensios for known file tipe, apply!
Now go to folder where is your movie, right click on it, properties, under general where is the title of the movie you change last three letters from mkv to avi or divx, hit apply and you are done!!

Just be sure to check that bow for file extensions back to avoid problems!

Again, this works for me, hope it will solve your problems!
